intro: Lobelia strictiflora, commonly known as the rigid-flowered lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. Lobelia strictiflora produces blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
